intro: Gynoxys azuayensis, commonly known as the Azuay gynoxys, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments at moderate elevations. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
